# interpret.plot_comparisons { #bambi.interpret.plot_comparisons }

```python
interpret.plot_comparisons(
    model,
    idata,
    contrast,
    conditional=None,
    average_by=None,
    comparison_type='diff',
    sample_new_groups=False,
    use_hdi=True,
    prob=None,
    legend=True,
    transforms=None,
    ax=None,
    fig_kwargs=None,
    subplot_kwargs=None,
)
```

Plot Conditional Adjusted Comparisons

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

<code>[**model**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[bambi](`bambi`).[Model](`bambi.Model`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The model for which we want to plot the predictions.

<code>[**idata**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[arviz](`arviz`).[InferenceData](`arviz.InferenceData`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The InferenceData object that contains the samples from the posterior distribution of the model.

<code>[**contrast**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [([str](`str`), [dict](`dict`), [list](`list`))]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The predictor name whose contrast we would like to compare.

<code>[**conditional**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [([str](`str`), [dict](`dict`), [list](`list`))]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   The covariates we would like to condition on. If dict, keys are the covariate names and values are the values to condition on.

<code>[**average_by**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[str](`str`) \| [list](`list`) \| None]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   The covariates we would like to average by. The passed covariate(s) will marginalize over the other covariates in the model. Defaults to `None`.

<code>[**comparison_type**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[str](`str`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [\'diff\']{.parameter-default}</code>

:   The type of comparison to plot. Defaults to 'diff'.

<code>[**sample_new_groups**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[bool](`bool`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [False]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   If the model contains group-level effects, and data is passed for unseen groups, whether to sample from the new groups. Defaults to `False`.

<code>[**use_hdi**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[bool](`bool`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [True]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Whether to compute the highest density interval (defaults to True) or the quantiles.

<code>[**prob**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[float](`float`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   The probability for the credibility intervals. Must be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.94. Changing the global variable `az.rcParam["stats.ci_prob"]` affects this default.

<code>[**legend**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[bool](`bool`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [True]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Whether to automatically include a legend in the plot. Defaults to `True`.

<code>[**transforms**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[dict](`dict`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Transformations that are applied to each of the variables being plotted. The keys are the name of the variables, and the values are functions to be applied. Defaults to `None`.

<code>[**ax**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[matplotlib](`matplotlib`).[axes](`matplotlib.axes`).[_subplots](`matplotlib.axes._subplots`).[AxesSubplot](`matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   A matplotlib axes object or a sequence of them. If None, this function instantiates a new axes object. Defaults to `None`.

<code>[**fig_kwargs**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[optional](`optional`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Keyword arguments passed to the matplotlib figure function as a dict. For example, `fig_kwargs=dict(figsize=(11, 8)), sharey=True` would make the figure 11 inches wide by 8 inches high and would share the y-axis values.

<code>[**subplot_kwargs**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[optional](`optional`)]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Keyword arguments used to determine the covariates used for the horizontal, group, and panel axes. For example, `subplot_kwargs=dict(main="x", group="y", panel="z")` would plot the horizontal axis as `x`, the color (hue) as `y`, and the panel axis as `z`.

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

<code>[]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [([matplotlib](`matplotlib`).[figure](`matplotlib.figure`).[Figure](`matplotlib.figure.Figure`), [matplotlib](`matplotlib`).[axes](`matplotlib.axes`).[_subplots](`matplotlib.axes._subplots`).[AxesSubplot](`matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot`))]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   A tuple with the figure and the axes.

## Raises {.doc-section .doc-section-raises}

<code>[:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[ValueError](`ValueError`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   If the number of contrast levels is greater than 2 and `average_by` is `None`. If `conditional` and `average_by` are both `None`. If length of `conditional` is greater than 3 and `average_by` is `None`. If `average_by` is `True`. If main covariate is not numeric or categoric.
